title.rendered: Incopro recognised in Financial Times Award for Innovation

content.rendered:
Incopro’s work in helping clients target their enforcement of IP has been recognised by the Financial Times.

The Incopro brand protection service was a key factor in securing Wiggin LLP’s recognition as the Most Innovative Law Firm in Intellectual Property Law. Incopro is a market-leading online rights monitoring and brand protection company offering a unique service – it focuses on applying technical, legal and intelligence based expertise to online IP issues.

Commenting on the award, Simon Baggs, who is co-founder and CEO of Incopro, said: “This is fantastic recognition for Incopro, proving that an ability to innovate and embrace technology is critical in ensuring that clients’ interests are fully protected in the online world. Existing brand monitoring providers focus on identifying a volume of online issues. We aim to work with other law firms, providing our technology and intelligence alongside their legal and strategic expertise, to deliver real value to their clients”.

Simon was also among the 10 finalists for most innovative individual lawyer and Helen Saunders, Incopro’s Head of Operations and Intelligence, has also been commended for her work.

Please click here to see the full FT report on the awards.
